job_title: Faculty of Nursing in Red Deer, AB
pros: Smaller community feel with excellent professional development . Smaller class sizes compared to big city universities. Reasonable parking and strong partnership with community
cons: Winter is long in Red Deer. There is no pool at the college and small workout area. No track to walk to keep healthy during the long winters. Some courses require driving winter roads to meet students in practicum

pros: Wonderful supportive colleagues and good opportunities for professional development
cons: Since current president has been on board, there has been much discontent.  Decided to add another layer of administrators as his soldiers.  Very oppressive.  Many employees spend all day in meetings to help make decisions while now fully well that their opinions are not valued.  Tax payers should be upset how their money is being spent.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Red Deer, AB
pros: Excellent group of people both faculty and non-teaching staff. Supportive and giving.
cons: Too corporate. Senior management is scared of union expansion. Poor bargaining record.  Treat most employees as disposable. Treat non-faculty as "just support staff," and faculty as near god-like.

job_title: General Manager in Red Deer, AB
pros: few good colleagues and have a nice gym
cons: discrimination, dictator leaders, low educated senior managers, harassment, does not embrace diversity, salary is not compatible with your experience, full of gossip and fear, full of back stabbing, not open to change, No integrity, no inclusiveness, no accountability, run from this place.
